newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Duma adopts hard currency purchase tax.
newsitem.headline: Russian Duma adopts hard currency purchase tax.

text.p: The Russian Duma, the lower house of parliament, passed a draft law on a 0.5 percent tax on hard currency purchases by households, Interfax news agency said on Friday.
The Duma sent the draft to the Federation Council upper house for consideration, it said.
Last December the Duma passed the law, but it was turned down by Federation Council.
The government, which proposed the tax at 1.5 percent, had expected to get 2.3 trillion roubles from the tax in the first quarter.
